name: GistRun
description: GistRun was created by Aurelia core team member Jeremy Danyow, it runs and edits GitHub Gists (surprise). GistRun is built with Aurelia, uses the GitHub API and is hosted on GitHub pages. CloudFlare provides DNS and Heroku hosts GistRun's integration with GitHub's OAuth web application flow.

name: Aurelia Hub
description: The HUB is a place where Aurelia developers will come to learn, research, interact and gain access to all they need to be successful while building applications on the Aurelia platform. The hub itself is built on the Aurelia CLI (just like this site), however the source code is not currently public.

name: Pokego.run
description: Pokego.run is a Pokemon spotting map where you can record Pokemon sightings for others to discover.

name: Kchomp
description: Kchomp is an all in one content aggregator application built with Aurelia.

name: Markdown Editor
description: A fully-featured Markdown Editor built using Aurelia in a few short hours. It is built as an example for Aurelia book author Dwayne Charrington's upcoming book Aurelia For Real World Web Applications in which you build this application and get the source code for it.

name: Aurelia Auth
description: Aurelia Auth is a plugin for adding in authentication to your Aurelia applications.
